fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: • Recent articles said 18.1 million people had entered the UK between 1 January and 23 March, without making clear that these figures were for air passengers only (Over 95,000 have entered UK since lockdown, 14 May, page 12, late edition; New quarantine measures ‘don’t make logical sense’, 15 May, page 2). • For any readers puzzling over 8 down in Friday’s cryptic crossword (No 28,140, 22 May, page 12, Journal), the anagram fodder contained one A too many. The clue should have been: “Unusually daring type of dressing”. • Other recently amended articles include: James Cousins review – power and creative vision in three short films Plans for contact-tracing in doubt as app not ready until June
